channel.title: meego on NO TITLE
channel.description: Recent content in meego on NO TITLE

item.title: Opened the MeeGo Porting project(Unofficial) on gitorious!
item.description: Many people are asking me about the MeeGo porting. Of course, I didn’t fully explain how meego to work on the Nexus One. So I provided my resource to the gitorious. then please try them!http://gitorious.org/meego-portingAlso I’m trying to work Toshiba AC100 is based NVIDIA Tegra. Also I’ll push them.Happy Hacking! :)

item.title: Japan Linux Conference 2010 Porting MeeGo to Android platforms 20101112
item.description: Text is only Japanese sorry.Check out this SlideShare Presentation:Japan Linux Conference 2010 Porting MeeGo to Android platforms 20101112View more presentationsfrom Mitsutaka Amano.

item.title: MeeGo 1.1 for NexusOne status part2 and how to work(Using microSD and No fastboot! You can also dualboot both of MeeGo and Android).
item.description: As you see, Here is about MeeGo 1.1 can boot on NexusOne from microSD via fastboot. Part1: http://blog.mitsutaka.org/2010/11/meego-11-for-nexusone-status-and-how-to.htmlAs I referred at LinuxCon Japan, Next step is standalone boot. So it’s complete replacement. Android => MeeGo. BTW, The slide of LinuxCon Japan is the following.http://events.linuxfoundation.org/slides/2010/linuxcon_japan/linuxcon_jp2010_amano.pdfhttp://www.slideshare.net/mitsutaka/linuxcon-japan-2010-porting-meego-to-other-devices-20100927Warning: APPLY THIS AT YOUR OWN RISK!I replaced boot.img the Android to MeeGo. But boot partition(/dev/mtdblock2) is too small. This block only can write data about 2.5MB. So It can’t put fully rootfs or intelligent initrd.

item.title: MeeGo 1.1 for NexusOne status and how to work(Using microSD and Boot vi fastboot).
item.description: Updated on 20101107(kernel build, kickstart file, dialer screenshot, fdisk /dev/mmcblk0) Part2. Single boot: http://blog.mitsutaka.org/2010/11/meego-11-for-nexusone-status-part2-and.htmlAs you know, MeeGo could be worked on the NexusOne. It was v1.1 development release that time. Then I tried if MeeGo 1.1 final release could work on it. Of course, It could be work. and We’ve made it more responsive to running.1. Linux kernel zImage is loaded from PC via fastboot command. It uses the Android kernel for MSM.

item.title: LinuxCon Japan 2010 my summary and review
item.description: LinuxCon Japan is the premiere Linux conference in Asia. Attending many core open source developers, kernel hackers, administrators, users and so on. It’s an important opportunity for open source contributors. So this is my summary and review.About my session. It’s my first time presentation in English. Actually I had prepared three months. First, I’m not a native speaker. don’t speak English well. So it needed. Second, My presentation was a plan to port the MeeGo to a device.

item.title: LinuxCon Japan 2010 Porting MeeGo to Other devices 20100927
item.description: Check out this SlideShare Presentation: LinuxCon Japan 2010 Porting MeeGo to Other devices 20100927View more presentationsfrom Mitsutaka Amano.

item.title: MeeGo 1.1 Development Release(1.0.90.1.20100831.1) for N900 status
item.description: As you know, MeeGo 1.1 Development Release(Nightly build) has been released. I saved some log files on my N900 when it was booted by microSD.I used in the following files.meego-handset-armv7l-n900-nokia-proprietary-1.0.90.1.20100831.1-mmcblk0p.raw.bz2meego-handset-armv7l-n900-nokia-proprietary-1.0.90.1.20100831.1-vmlinuz-2.6.35.3-5.2-n900You can get this image from http://tablets-dev.nokia.com/meego-codedrop.php on which you need your N900 product ID.BTW, N900 image can display the Handset UX. Also rotation can be worked.dmesg[ 0.000000] Linux version 2.6.35.3-5.2-n900 (abuild@build04) (gcc version 4.5.0 20100414 (MeeGo 4.5.0-1) (GCC) ) #1 PREEMPT Wed Aug 25 20:14:23 UTC 2010[ 0.

item.title: OSC2010 Tokyo MeeGo 20100910
item.description: Check out this SlideShare Presentation: MeeGo update information. Japanese onlyOSC2010 Tokyo MeeGo 20100910View more presentationsfrom Mitsutaka Amano.

item.title: Memo: dmesg and X.org.0.log on the MeeGo + Nexus One
item.description: MeeGo kernel was paniced on the N1. then I used android kernel was built by myself.X.Org doesn’t work yet. dmesg[ 0.000000] Initializing cgroup subsys cpu[ 0.000000] Linux version 2.6.29-droid-debian (dbrowne@TheBria) (gcc version 4.4.0 (GCC) ) #11 PREEMPT Mon Feb 8 01:02:44 EST 2010[ 0.000000] CPU: ARMv7 Processor [510f00f2] revision 2 (ARMv7), cr=10c5387f[ 0.000000] CPU: VIPT nonaliasing data cache, VIVT ASID tagged instruction cache[ 0.000000] Machine: mahimahi[ 0.000000] Ignoring unrecognised tag 0x4d534d71[ 0.

item.title: My CFP has been accepted LinuxCon Japan
item.description: Yesteaday, LInuxCon Japan was published session schedule by The Linux Foundationhttp://events.linuxfoundation.org/events/linuxcon-japan/scheduleActually, I posted CFP(Call For Partitipation). Making a presentation in English, That’s one of the my goal. I got a chance:)My session is “Porting MeeGo to another devices”. MeeGo is supported Netbooks, Nokia N900 smartphone now. MeeGo is released arm and x86 binaries.This is an opportunity that can use and support many devices. I’m sure we can do it. Also I have already ported ubuntu lucid to Nexus One.

item.title: MeeGo 1.0 for N900 status
item.description: As you know, MeeGo 1.0 has been released. Netbook has the User Experience then you can test that using image on your netbook. But N900 and IVI image has no UX. They seem to be development release in position :(I have a time now, so I output dmesg on my N900 when it was booted by microSD and temporaly boot of kernel.I used in the following files.meego-n900-open-armv7l-1.0.0.20100525.1-sda.raw.bz2 ( bzcat xxx.bz2 | dd of=/dev/sdX(microSD) bs=4k)meego-n900-open-armv7l-1.

item.title: First step, watching git repositories of the MeeGo project
item.description: Currently, MeeGo sources were managed by gitorioushttp://meego.gitorious.org/It has already been published 44 git repositories in the following. (20100519)git://gitorious.org/qemu-maemo/qemu.gitgit://gitorious.org/qemu-maemo/gles-libs.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-openmax.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-dsp.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gstreamer.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-plugins-base.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-plugins-good.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-plugins-bad.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/dsp-tools.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-multimedia/gst-nokia-videosrc.gitgit://gitorious.org/tracker/tracker.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/bluez-packaging.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/obexd-packaging.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/maemo-bluez-compat.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/osso-gwobex.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/osso-obc.gitgit://gitorious.org/maemo-bluetooth/openobex-packaging.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-cellular/libcmtspeechdata.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-platform-security/refhashutils.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-platform-security/libcreds2.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-platform-security/dpkg.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/image-creator.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/spectacle.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/bootchart.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/madde.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/obs-project-config.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/kickstarter.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-developer-tools/qt-creator.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-netbook-ux/abrt-netbook.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-netbook-ux/google-gadgets-meego.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-netbook-ux/eom.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/uxlaunch.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/fastinit.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/kernel-source.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/gconf-dbus.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/package-groups.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/meego-rpm-config.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/sreadahead.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/image-configurations.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-os-base/image-tools.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-middleware/libsynthesis.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-middleware/syncevolution.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-middleware/libsocialweb.gitgit://gitorious.org/meego-middleware/librest.gitYou can watch some updates with gitorious service. My way to copy the URL to a file, and git clone.$ for repo in cat git.list; do git clone $repo ; done

item.title: About MeeGo, MeeGo Netbooks UX screenshots
item.description: As you know, MeeGo codes has been opened on the end of March. You can get ia32/arm RPMS/SRPMS now. http://repo.meego.comBut currently User eXperience doesn’t published. MeeGo community promised to release at Stard of April. And then, The promise was carried out :-) But we can only boot up and see console screen. There were some opinion to this activity on MeeGo mailing list. For example, “User interface has not been released.
